description: Daisuke "Pixel" Amaya, a Japanese programmer, released PxTone in the mid-2000s as a successor to the Organya engine used in Cave Story, which Pixel also developed. Its primary users are hobbyist composers and game developers looking to create retro-style soundtracks and effects.
NOTE: PxTone and "pxtone" are used interchangeably.
